text: Dwi Lestari Pramesti "Mesty" Ariotedjo (born April 25, 1989) is an Indonesian medical doctor, Mesty Ariotedjo is the youngest member of World Economic Forum 2014 from Indonesia. She was the only representative and speaker at International Non Communicable Diseases (NCD) Children Conference, Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago, from Indonesia. She is also a member of Global Shapers Jakarta. ==Early life== Ariotedjo was born in Jakarta. Her father, Arie Ariotedjo, works as a business executive in a various companies. Her mother, Arti Ariotedjo (née Prawirakusumah), is a socialite and a housewife. Her grandfather, Sri Bima Ariotedjo, was the Indonesian Ambassador to the Philippines during President Soeharto's presidency. Ariotedjo was raised as a Muslim. She has Javanese ancestry from her father and Sundanese from her mother. Ariotedjo graduated from SMA Negeri 8 Jakarta in 2007. In 2012, she graduated from Faculty of Medicine, University of Indonesia. ==References== ==External links== *Official site Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:People from Jakarta Category:Indonesian female models Category:Indonesian harpists Category:Indonesian musicians Category:Javanese people Category:Sundanese people Category:Indonesian Muslims Category:SMA Negeri 8 Jakarta alumni Category:University of Indonesia alumni
title: Mesty Ariotedjo
